definition: to accompany/to keep sb company/to assist/old variant of 賠|赔[pei2]

sentences.english: We now have e-friends to help us and keep us company.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在都有了电子朋友来帮助我们并陪伴我们。

sentences.english: When she was arrested at Notre Dame last month, he was right beside her.
sentences.chinese: 当她上个月在圣母大学被捕后，特里一直陪伴着她。

sentences.english: As soon as the people saw him, they brought thirty companions to be with him.
sentences.chinese: 众人看见参孙，就请了三十个人陪伴他。

sentences.english: We enjoy the adventure, the comfort and the companionship that friendship offers.
sentences.chinese: 我们喜欢友谊给我们带来的冒险，安慰和陪伴。

sentences.english: Petra had been with this swan-shaped boat for years.
sentences.chinese: 蓓特拉已经陪伴在这只天鹅形踏板船身边多年了。

sentences.english: One of Tai Shan's caretakers and a veterinarian from the Washington National Zoo are expected to accompany them on the journey.
sentences.chinese: 泰山的一个饲养员和一名兽医希望在旅途中陪伴泰山。

sentences.english: Most of the time I spent there was with Mr. Gillespie.
sentences.chinese: 我在那里的大部分时间都是陪伴着吉尔斯拜先生。

sentences.english: He would sometimes be accompanied by the slim, fair-haired court pages .
sentences.chinese: 有时候还有几个金发苗条的内侍陪伴他。

sentences.english: Only the bright moon comes to shine on me.
sentences.chinese: 却有明月陪伴，殷勤来相照。

sentences.english: When one treats the mushroom correctly, it thrives , germinates, and will accompany its owner for life.
sentences.chinese: 当正确处理菌菇，繁殖，发育，和陪伴主人终生。

sentences.english: She is in attendance on the sick child.
sentences.chinese: 我陪伴着生病的孩子彻夜未眠。

sentences.english: He lived alone in the big house with only the memory of his late wife for company.
sentences.chinese: 他只在对亡妻怀念之情的陪伴中独居于那所大屋子里。

sentences.english: Accompanied by His cowherd boyfriends, Sri Krsna entered the charming forest of Vrndavana.
sentences.chinese: 主奎师那在牧牛童的陪伴下走进迷人的温达文森林。

sentences.english: An intense young interpreter accompanied him.
sentences.chinese: 一名热情的年轻译员陪伴着他。

sentences.english: As a friend to accompany a large class.
sentences.chinese: 因为有着一大班朋友陪伴。

sentences.english: When I studied late at night, she was always there, and gave me a cup of hot milk.
sentences.chinese: 当我晚上学习很晚，她总能陪伴着我，给我一杯热奶。

definition: to accompany/to keep sb company/to assist/old variant of 賠|赔[pei2]
to accompany sb/to accompany each other
to show concern and care for
to pass/to spend (time)/to survive/to get through
to constantly have (sb or sth) on one's mind
to take care of/to show consideration/to attend to/to look after
care/solicitude/to show care for/concerned about/attentive to
